bibl.title: Ernest Hutchinson v. City of Seattle. Warrant
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US Circuit Courts, Western District Of Washington, Seattle; Law Register Northern Division, 1899-1906, vol2.

div1.p: The City of Seattle vs. Ernest Hutchinson Plaintiff Defendant
State of Washington, County of King, The City of Seattle, ss.
In Justice Court, Seattle precinct, T.H. Cann, Police Judge.
THE STATE OF WASHIGNTON to the CHIEF OF POLICE OF SAID CITY, OR SHERIFF OR CONSTABLE OF SAID COUNTY, GREETING:

complained in writing, under oath, to the undersigned, one of the Justices of the peace and Police Judge in and for said Seattle Precinct, King County, that on the 14th day of January 1904, in said City: County and State, did commit the offence of unlawfully attempting to sell goods and merchandise by selling trading stamps in said city.
Wherefore, in the name of the State of Washington, you are commanded forthwith to apprehend the said Defendant and bring him before me to be dealth with according to Law.
Given under my hand this 1st day of February, 1904 R.R. George Police Judge
State of Washington, County of King, The City of Seattle, ss.
I Hereby Certify That I have arrested the within named Ernest Hutchinson and have him now in court. John Sullivan, Chief of Police. By
